headline: NHS England's Transition From Biogen's Drug To Sandoz's Biosimilar Sparks Alarm As Multiple Sclerosis Patients Report Severe Effects
summary: A cost-saving effort by NHS England to transition multiple sclerosis (MS) patients from Biogen Inc’s (NASDAQ:BIIB) Tysabri (natalizumab) to the biosimilar drug Tyruko has led to significant side effects. At Charing Cross Hospital in London, about 170 multiple sclerosis patients experienced complications, including relapses, mobility issues, fatigue, pain, and weight gain. Some cases were severe enough to require hospitalization. Also Read: Biogen Strengthens Pipeline With Stoke Therapeutic’s Dra
